JobFullDesc: Are you interested in joining a startup within Microsoft where you'll have the rare opportunity to create the future of IT management and help drive the company's Modern Workplace initiative?  Microsoft Managed Desktop (MMD) is a SaaS service that delivers all aspects of modern IT management for our customers.  We serve a diverse set of customers ranging from financial institutions like Lloyds Banking Group (LBG), Governments, and even sports teams. Devices managed by MMD are more secure, more up-to-date, and perform better than traditionally managed devices. Built entirely on Azure, MMD extends the Microsoft Intelligent Cloud platform by leveraging Microsoft identity service, (Azure Active Directory or AAD), Microsoft Endpoint Manager service (MEM aka Intune), device management,  endpoint security, and desktop analytics to build a set of global services and operations at scale to create a secure, productive, and turnkey computing environment for enterprises. MMD is getting rapid adoption and we are looking for a seasoned Security Engineer to join our team to drive excellence in Security as we scale and grow.  For more about MMD: Video: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RE2RWOt?autoplay=trueDocs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/managed-desktop/ Responsibilities   Threat Modeling / Security Assessments - Parlaying research and knowledge into threat modeling and security assessments of new MMD features and microservices. You will help identify, prioritize, and address risks that affect MMD's ability to protect, detect, investigate and recover from security vulnerabilities and targeted attacks.   Contribute to security roadmap - Contribute to MMD’s security roadmap to ensure that our learnings are properly reflected in from sprint plans to semester plans. Ensure that we follow proper standards and practices, to ensure the lowest practical likelihood of introducing security bugs.   Security Code Reviews – Prioritize highest risk features and review source code for security defects. File bugs on security defects that help remove potentially exploitable bugs from code and will improve the security of our service. Coordinate penetration testing activities.  Communication & Presentation - Be an advocate, champion, and trusted advisor for all things Security within the team. Be available to answer questions and give guidance to engineering teams on how to address and detect security vulnerabilities. Create, track and present security metrics. Present team findings through proof-of-concept exploits, white papers, and security assessment reports. Work with the other teams to define and adopt new best practices for secure development and operations (e.g.: you will be the primary security liaison between MMD and the broader Microsoft/M365 Security teams; you will help mobilize org-wide incident responses).  Emerging Threat Research - Be on the forefront of emerging global cybersecurity threats. This includes research of externally found vulnerabilities and cybersecurity attacks as well as proactive security research on security advancements and technology.  Qualifications   A minimum of a Bachelors degree in Digital Security, Information Technology, Information Assurance, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical experience is required. You have 7+ years experience in Application/Cloud security or Security operations. Experience dealing with security events (e.g.: security breaches), as is the ability to identify themes and trends through data analysis.  Experience working with or in an engineering/product team. Software development background preferred. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
